com.google.code.jscep.transport
Class Transport

java.lang.Object
  com.google.code.jscep.transport.Transport
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpGetTransport, HttpPostTransport
public abstract class Transport
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a transport for sending a message to the SCEP server.

Example usage: 

 Request<?> req = ...;
 URL url = new URL("http://www.example.org/scep/pki-client.exe");
 Proxy proxy = Proxy.NO_PROXY;
 Transport trans = Transport.createTransport(Transport.Method.POST, url, proxy);
 Object res = trans.setMessage(req);

Author:
David Grant

          Represents the HTTP method to be used for transport.

Returns the URL configured for use by this transport.

Returns:

getProxy

public java.net.Proxy getProxy()
Returns the proxy configured for use by this Transport.

If no proxy was used to construct this Transport, this method returns Proxy.NO_PROXY.

Returns:
the proxy.

sendMessage

public abstract <T> T sendMessage(Request<T> msg)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Sends the given request to the URL provided in the constructor and uses the Request's content handler to parse the response.

Type Parameters:
T - the response type.
Parameters:
msg - the message to send.
Returns:
the response of type T.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if any I/O error occurs.
See Also:
Request.getContentHandler()
